summary: This is an email exchange between G. Max and Philip Levine discussing a third party (name redacted) who is seeking an internship, with G. Max suggesting she should 'irritate' Levine about it and be 'hopefully accommodating.' The document appears to be part of the Epstein case records, suggesting potential connections to recruitment or favor-seeking activities.

persons.name: Philip Levine
persons.role: Email recipient, person being asked for internship favor
persons.context: Addressee in email chain where G. Max suggests a woman should approach him about a fashion internship and be 'hopefully accommodating.'

events.title: Email discussion about internship arrangement
events.description: G. Max emails Philip Levine about a woman who will be meeting him, suggesting she should ask about a fashion internship and be 'hopefully accommodating.'

keyFacts: Email shows G. Max arranging for a woman to approach Philip Levine about a fashion internship.
G. Max suggests the woman should 'irritate' Levine about the internship and be 'hopefully accommodating.'
The correspondence suggests potential favor-seeking or recruitment activity involving an unnamed woman.
Document is part of Epstein case records, indicating possible relevance to broader investigation patterns.
